Title: Hashimpura 22 May (Hindi Edition)

My Review: on 22 May the soldiers of PAC killed innocent muslims by opening fire on them. A black day in the history of Indian Democracy.

Title: The Country Without a Post Office
Author: Agha Shahid Ali

Title: Aurangzeb: The Man and the Myth
Author: Audrey Truschke
My Review: A glimpse into the life of demonised mughal ruler. As the subtitle suggests, this book differentiated between what's the truth and what is the myth. Do not get swayed by the hindutva narrative.

Title: The Free Voice: On Democracy, Culture and the Nation
Author: Ravish Kumar

Title: Celestial Bodies
Author: Jokha Alharthi
My Review: A delightful read. I've read very few Arab and Middle-East fiction but this book blew my mind. I have to admit that Arab writers are really really talented. It is high time that we should deviate ourselves from the canonical English authors to the more diverse and heterogeneous world literature.

Title: Two by Two
Author: Nicholas Sparks
My Review: Good story but language is dull at some points and becomes boring often which repels the reader. Overall novel was good as pastime, nothing distinguishable.
